page.title: 02Landscape around Maylandsea
page.content: Highest point{17m}above sea level. Very flat cultivated landscape. Hedges low. Evidence of Dutch Elm disease but little replanting. Field size 2.5 hectares to 35 hectares. Farm buildings unremarkable except for {Essex barns}at Brookmead and Nipsells farm. Mundon creek and Mayland creek - salt marsh sometimes covered at high tide. Mud flats exposed at low water. Marina at maylandsea and moorings for yachts in river. Reinforced sea wall. {Modern houses}and bungalows usually detached with front and rear gardens. Individual styles, brick built with tiled roofs.New estate of executive houses under construction. A few bungalows obviously older than surrounding properties.
